meanings.definition: The study or description of diseases.
meanings.sent1: Doctors use pathographies to learn more about different illnesses.
meanings.sent2: The pathographies in the medical library provide valuable information on various diseases.
meanings.sent3: Reading pathographies can be both informative and eye-opening.
meanings.sent4: Her book on cancer is a pathography of the struggles faced by patients.
meanings.sent5: The pathographies painted a vivid picture of the impact of diseases on individuals.

meanings.definition: A written account of someone's experience with illness.
meanings.sent1: She decided to write a pathography to share her journey with others.
meanings.sent2: The pathographies in the waiting room offered comfort to patients going through similar experiences.
meanings.sent3: His pathography had a touch of humor, making it an enjoyable read.
meanings.sent4: The author's pathography was a window into the emotional challenges of illness.
meanings.sent5: Through her pathography, she aimed to inspire others facing health struggles.
